attributes.action: Make it the law to stop and report hitting a cat under the road traffic act 1988
attributes.additional_details:
It should be the same for cats as any other animal/pet covered under the road traffic act 1988. They are loved by many families across the country and although sometimes unavoidable, hitting a cat with a car and reporting it/taking it to the vets immediately increases their chance of survival

Cats are family pets and mean a lot to families that have them. There have been too many cases recently of cats being hit and then left to die in the road despite there being a chance to save them.
Only 25% of cats hit by cars die as a result of this, this means that the other 75% have a chance of survival if taken to a vet
attributes.background: It should be made law to stop and report hitting a cat as currently this does not exist unless the animal is a dog, sheep, pig or cattle etc.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607317
